title: Question 51

children: A 31-year-old woman is evaluated for the recent onset of an asymptomatic rash, as
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Tinea versicolor (pityriasis versicolor) is characterized by slightly scaly hyper- or hypopigmented macules and patches of the upper trunk and upper arms. The causative yeast organism,

, is a normal inhabitant of the skin; however, when hot and humid environmental conditions favor its growth, symptoms appear. Diagnosis is confirmed by microscopic evaluation of a potassium hydroxide preparation made from scrapings of lesions. The preparation
demonstrates the classic appearance of both spores and hyphae in a "spaghetti and meatball" pattern.
